abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio's proposed budget allocates $1.27 billion to parks, but critics say it does not solve maintenance problems and lacks plan for new parkland; they are concerned he is not very interested in city's parks, but City Hall officials defend his record.
lead_paragraph: Critics of Mayor Bill de Blasio’s budget say it fails to address nagging maintenance problems in the system and lacks a vision for new parkland; City Hall officials defend his record.

headline.main: On City Parks, Mayor de Blasio Is Seen as Friend, Foe and Something in Between
headline.print_headline: On City Parks, Mayor Is Seen as Friend, Foe and Something in Between

snippet: Critics of Mayor Bill de Blasio’s budget say it fails to address nagging maintenance problems in the system and lacks a vision for new parkland; City Hall officials defend his record.
